headline: A Fresh Look at Alpine Income Property Trust’s (PINE) Valuation Following Major Richmond Retail Acquisition
summary: Alpine Income Property Trust (NYSE:PINE) just completed a $20.7 million purchase of fully leased retail space in Richmond, Virginia. The property is anchored by Walmart and introduces TJ Maxx to its lineup. This move immediately strengthens the REIT’s exposure to investment-grade tenants. See our latest analysis for Alpine Income Property Trust. headline: Exclusive-Amazon, Flipkart take aim at India's banks with new consumer loan offerings
summary: MUMBAI (Reuters) -Amazon is preparing to offer loans to small businesses in India, while Walmart-owned Flipkart is looking at buy-now, pay-later (BNPL) ​products as the e-commerce giants take on the country's banks with a push into financial products.  Amazon acquired ‌Bengaluru-based non-bank lender Axio earlier this year.  Currently focused on BNPL and personal loans, Axio will re-embark on offering credit for small businesses ‌and start offering cash management solutions.

content.title: Exclusive-Amazon, Flipkart take aim at India's banks with new consumer loan offerings
content.summary: MUMBAI (Reuters) -Amazon is preparing to offer loans to small businesses in India, while Walmart-owned Flipkart is looking at buy-now, pay-later (BNPL) ​products as the e-commerce giants take on the country's banks with a push into financial products.  Amazon acquired ‌Bengaluru-based non-bank lender Axio earlier this year.  Currently focused on BNPL and personal loans, Axio will re-embark on offering credit for small businesses ‌and start offering cash management solutions.

headline: Walmart stock has an 'edge' on Amazon, Target is 'left in the dust'
summary: Walmart (WMT) is outperforming its retail rivals like Target (TGT) by leveraging tech like Amazon (AMZN), Capital Advisors' head of equity and portfolio manager David Wagner tells Yahoo Finance. Wagner compares the three stocks and outlines his top pick. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Mickey Drexler weighs in on Walmart, Target CEO transitions
summary: As Black Friday shopping and deal-hunting is in full swing, Alex Mill chairman Millard "Mickey" Drexler sits down with Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi to talk about the quality of retail products and share his thoughts on the leadership succession for major chains Walmart (WMT) and Target (TGT). Also catch Mickey Drexler discuss the relationship between retailers and value offering amid tariff-fueled inflation in 2025. Drexler also worked as the former CEO of Gap (GAP) and J. Crew and is the founder of Madewell and Old Navy. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

content.title: Mickey Drexler weighs in on Walmart, Target CEO transitions
content.description:
As Black Friday shopping and deal-hunting is in full swing, Alex Mill chairman Millard "Mickey" Drexler sits down with Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi to talk about the quality of retail products and share his thoughts on the leadership succession for major chains Walmart (WMT) and Target (TGT).

Also catch Mickey Drexler discuss the relationship between retailers and value offering amid tariff-fueled inflation in 2025.

Drexler also worked as the former CEO of Gap (GAP) and J. Crew and is the founder of Madewell and Old Navy.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

Also catch Mickey Drexler discuss the relationship between retailers and value offering amid tariff-fueled inflation in 2025. Drexler also worked as the former CEO of Gap (GAP) and J. headline: Retail Stocks Move Cautiously Higher. Beware the ‘Silly Season.’
summary: Retail stocks were on track to post modest gains in Friday’s holiday-shortened trading session.  The SPDR S&P Retail ETF, also known by its ticker, XRT, was up 0.2%, compared with the S&P 500’s 0.3% gain.  Walmart stock was up 0.8%, Costco Wholesale gained 0.5%, and Target rose 1.5%.

content.title: Retail Stocks Move Cautiously Higher. Beware the ‘Silly Season.’
content.summary: Retail stocks were on track to post modest gains in Friday’s holiday-shortened trading session.  The SPDR S&P Retail ETF, also known by its ticker, XRT, was up 0.2%, compared with the S&P 500’s 0.3% gain.  Walmart stock was up 0.8%, Costco Wholesale gained 0.5%, and Target rose 1.5%.

headline: Amazon Owns Black Friday
summary: Americans spent $10 billion online on Black Friday 2025. There is no reason to think this year will be different. A look at Amazon’s (NASDAQ: AZMN) earnings report shows the extent to which it dominated the day. There are tens of thousands of retailers, at least. In the US, we are making money online on ...
